DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication whether the temperature result was clinically significant.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vital Signs Domain Temperature Vital Signs Clinical Significance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to vital sign._A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium._An indication or description that the outcome of the vital signs assessment was clinically significant.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record whether the temperature result was clinically significant.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SUPPVS.QVAL
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM = "VSCLSIG" and SUPPVS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
